name: WhiteSource
description: Detect security vulnerabilities, problematic open source licenses.
author: WhiteSource

inputs.name: cwd
inputs.label: Root working directory
inputs.helpMarkDown: Root work directory: Working directory where WhiteSource is run. Defaults to the root of the source working directory. Using [globe-pattern]( https://github.com/isaacs/node-glob).

inputs.name: projectName
inputs.label: Project name
inputs.helpMarkDown:
A name that uniquely identifies the WhiteSource project to create. 
Enter a unique name for the new project. 

When unchecking the 'Overwrite projects with latest build data' checkbox
from Organization Settings > Extensions > WhiteSource, a new 
WhiteSource project is created for every build run and its name will include 
the build id as a suffix.

inputs.name: configuration
inputs.label: WhiteSource Configuration
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Specifies Unified Agent Configuration parameters to be used by the WhiteSource task. 
Ensure each parameter along with its value are provided on a separate line. 

For example: 
npm.resolveDependencies=true 

[Unified Agent Configuration parameters]( https://whitesource.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/WD/pages/804814917/Unified+Agent+Configuration+File+and+Parameters)
